item.title: Dog poo from large dog, now trodden in, 13th October
item.description:
Large dog poo seen on pavement at Northwould end of Narford Road, outside entrance of Council block, opposite Salvesen House at 10am and 10.45. Saw as for fixmystreet in Love Hackney, and rechecked at 5pm and now troddenin. Same dog poo seen many times

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Narford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a dip in the road recently work was carried out the dip seems to be getting worse, 13th October
item.description:
The dip in the road is outside my house I have recently painted the front of my house every time the dip fills with water and cars go passed the dirty water goes all over my house and windows it is a busy road When the work was carried out on the road it was the hole was not filled in properly I would appreciate this to be looked into as soon as possible so no damage is done to my property

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dishwasher been dumped and left, 13th October
item.description:
We are the letting agent who manage the block of flats at 3 de crespigny park and we have had reports from tenants of someone who has passed by and dumped a washing machine outside the front of the flats. It has remained there for a couple days and no one has came to collect it or remove it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, De Crespigny Park, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More rubbish in fly tip alley, 13th October
item.description:
More house waste in alleyway. It's a weekly event now. Every man and his dog from SE7 knows who is responsible. Please can RBG take some action, Thank you

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Constant fly tipping in alleyway, 13th October
item.description:
Constant fly tipping by the same person every week address in photo. Thinks she can chuck her rubbish including dirty soiled nappies house hold waste. Empty bottles of alcohol and old furniture causing rodents. She literally does it every week and doesnâ€™t even care that her address and other proofs of her address are in the rubbish. Reported this time and time again

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Charlton Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Endymion Rd - Noise 24hrs from loose gas cover in road - STILL NOT FIXED, 13th October
item.description:
The loose gas cover in Endymion Rd, near the junction with Alroy Rd makes a very loud noise when traffic passes over it which is especially disturbing when residents are trying to sleep. THIS WAS FIRST REPORTED VIA FIX MY STREET ON 31 AUGUST BUT AS AT 13/10/25 HAS STILL NOT BEEN REPAIRED. Please get it fixed IMMEDIATELY.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Endymion Road, Stroud Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slates keep blowing off the roof at 69 powerscroft road., 13th October
item.description:
This dilapidated venue has slates falling into the street directly adjacent to clapton girls and into the residential street of almack road. it's an eyesore but it's also evidently a health and safety risk. it needs to be repaired urgently.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on wall overlooking parliament., 13th October
item.description:
There's graffiti along a whole stretch of wall on the path by the Thames overlooking parliament. It's a favourite place for tourists because of the view but the graffiti makes it look like a dump.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Embankment, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bins and rubbish on gilbert road, 13th October
item.description:
There is a litter bin outside the shop at the end of gilbert road leading to picardy street and its overflowing with rubbish, this had lead to rubbish now being left in the streets. This has been reported on a number of occasions and the residents keep being told that there is nothing we can do about this as cars are parked and the street cleaning vehicle can not get to the rubbish. Please can alternative please be looked at and can this rubbish be cleared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gilbert Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pigeons often fly in groups across the Pitfield street, posing safety risks, 13th October
item.description:
Feeding pigeons in the church yard has led to noise, hygiene issues, and large flocks flying across roads and rooftops. To protect the environment and safety, feeding should be banned and pigeons prevented from perching on buildings.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Arden Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every weekend we have ludicrously overflowing bins outside 69 powerscroft road. it's not acceptable. it's disgusting., 13th October
item.description:
I don't like having rubbish stacked in my residential street and left there to fester for days. it's picked apart by foxes who drag rubbish into our front yard.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
